is looking for an experienced full-time news editor to bring our hard-hitting investigative reporting and analysis to the next level. The news editor will be deeply versed in money and politics and will closely follow the news cycle, in order to generate story ideas, assign reporting projects, and conduct top-level editing of draft articles from the reporting staff. The news editor will also work closely with the editor-in-chief and managing editor in supporting the newsroom and coordinating the publishing schedule. The news editor will occasionally write short news posts, and will have opportunities to develop innovative reporting projects. This is a full-time, salaried position with benefits including a generous health care stipend, office expense reimbursements, and paid time off.
At least three to five years experience as an editor.
A keen ability to track and respond to the ever-shifting news cycle.
Deep knowledge of U.S. political and financial systems.
Experience filing record requests, tracking political donations, and scrutinizing business records.
Excellent top-level editing skills, with the ability to turn around clean, accurate, and well-crafted copy on complex, highly scrutinized matters on tight deadlines.
